poem:
Title: "Ode to the Forgotten Lea"

River Lea, unsung and unpraised,
Carrying grain against the grain,
Second-born, silent sage of London's lace.
Through Bedford's bed, Hertford's heart,
A vein, vain, viral in the vibrant vista.
Reaching Thames, yet reaching none,
Unseen you flow, under sung, under sun.
The underdog of currents, your currency unknown,
In your solitude, your strength is sown.
